name: if (xxx)... (for matrix)
description: Copies one of 2 matrices, depending on "if" condition, to the output.

in_ports.caption: if (xxx)
in_ports.name: if
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] Should contain scalar value, indication true/false condition.
See "What string is true" and "Default condition" parameters.

in_ports.name: false
in_ports.hint:
This matrix is used when "if" value is false.
Note: in another case this data is not requested to be calculated!

in_ports.name: true
in_ports.hint:
This matrix is used when "if" value is true.
Note: in another case this data is not requested to be calculated!

out_ports.caption: if (xxx)
out_ports.name: if
out_ports.hint:
Copy of true/false input scalar.
Unlike input "if (xxx)" port, always contain a string "true" or "false".

controls.caption: What string is true
controls.name: conditionStyle
controls.description:
What input condition "xxx" is considered to be true and what is false.

C-like: true is non-zero number or non-empty string, containing not a number, false is 0, 0.0 or empty string.

Java-like: true is "true" string (ignoring case), false is any other string.

Note that "true" string, according these rules, is considered to be true in all modes.

controls.caption: Default condition
controls.name: defaultCondition
controls.description: If the input condition "xxx" is non-initialized, this flag is used instead of it.

controls.caption: Requires input
controls.name: inputRequired
controls.description: If set, the input port "true" or "false" (selected according "xxx" input condition) must contain some initialized matrix; in another case, this function will throw an exception. If this flag is cleared, empty input port doesn't lead to any effect: output port will still stay empty.
